Cells¶

Introduction¶

Cell objects are the atomics elements that compose a deep neural network.

Cell¶

If you wan to add the same parameters to multiple cells, you can use a ConfigSection

from n2d2.cell import Conv, Pool

conv_config = n2d2.ConfigSection(activation_function=Rectifier(),
                        weights_filler=He(),
                        weights_solver=SGD(**solver_config),
                        no_bias=True)
model = n2d2.deepnet.Sequence([
        Conv(3, 32, [4, 4], **conv_config),
        Pool([2, 2], stride_dims=[2, 2], pooling='Max'),
        Conv(20, 48, [5, 5], **conv_config),
        Pool([3, 3], stride_dims=[2, 2], pooling='Max'),
])

If you have compiled N2D2 with CUDA, you can also accelerate your network by using CUDA model. For this you just have to add this line at the beginning of the script :

..testcode:

n2d2.global_variables.default_model = "Frame_CUDA"
class n2d2.cell.Cell(**config_parameters)¶
N2D2()¶

Return the N2D2 object.

Conv¶

class n2d2.cell.Conv(nb_inputs, nb_outputs, kernel_dims, from_arguments=True, **config_parameters)¶

Convolutional layer.

Parameters

  • nb_outputs (int) – Number of output channels

  • name (str) – Name for the cell.

  • kernel_dims (list) – Kernel dimension.

  • sub_sample_dims (list, optional) – Dimension of the subsampling factor of the output feature maps

  • stride_dims (list, optional) – Dimension of the stride of the kernel.

  • padding_dims (list, optional) – Dimensions of the padding.

  • dilation_dims (list, optional) – Dimensions of the dilation of the kernels

  • activation_function (n2d2.activation.ActivationFunction, optional) – Activation function, default= n2d2.activation.Tanh

  • mapping (n2d2.tensor.Tensor) – Mapping

  • weights_filler (n2d2.filler.Filler, optional) – Weights initial values filler, default= n2d2.filler.Normal

  • bias_filler (n2d2.filler.Filler, optional) – Biases initial values filler, default= n2d2.filler.Normal

  • weights_solver (n2d2.solver.Solver, optional) – Solver for weights

  • bias_solver (n2d2.solver.Solver, optional) – Solver for biases

  • no_bias (bool, optional) – If True, don’t use bias, default=False

  • weights_export_flip (bool, optional) – If true, import/export flipped kernels, default=False

  • back_propagate (bool, optional) – If true, enable backpropagation, default=True

  • from_arguments (bool, optional) – If False, allow you to create cell with mandatory arguments set as None, default=False

N2D2()¶

Return the N2D2 object.

  • channel_index (int) –

Deconv¶

class n2d2.cell.Deconv(nb_inputs, nb_outputs, kernel_dims, from_arguments=True, **config_parameters)¶

Deconvolution layer.

Parameters

  • nb_outputs (int) – Number of output channels

  • name (str) – Name for the cell.

  • kernel_dims (list) – Kernel dimension.

  • sub_sample_dims (list, optional) – Dimension of the subsampling factor of the output feature maps

  • stride_dims (list, optional) – Dimension of the stride of the kernel.

  • padding_dims (list, optional) – Dimensions of the padding.

  • dilation_dims (list, optional) – Dimensions of the dilation of the kernels

  • activation_function (n2d2.activation.ActivationFunction, optional) – Activation function, default= n2d2.activation.Tanh

  • weights_filler (n2d2.filler.Filler, optional) – Weights initial values filler, default=NormalFiller

  • bias_filler (n2d2.filler.Filler, optional) – Biases initial values filler, default=NormalFiller

  • weights_solver (n2d2.solver.Solver, optional) – Solver for weights

  • bias_solver (n2d2.solver.Solver, optional) – Solver for biases

  • no_bias (bool, optional) – If True, don’t use bias, default=False

  • back_propagate (bool, optional) – If True, enable backpropagation, default=True

  • weights_export_flip (bool, optional) – If true, import/export flipped kernels, default=False

  • from_arguments (bool, optional) – If False, allow you to create cell with mandatory arguments set as None, default=False

N2D2()¶

Return the N2D2 object.

Fc¶

class n2d2.cell.Fc(nb_inputs, nb_outputs, from_arguments=True, **config_parameters)¶

Fully connected layer.

Parameters

  • nb_outputs (int) – Number of outputs of the cell.

  • name (str) – Name fo the cell.

  • activation_function (n2d2.activation.ActivationFunction, optional) – Activation function, default= n2d2.activation.Tanh

  • weights_solver (n2d2.solver.Solver, optional) – Solver for weights

  • bias_solver (n2d2.solver.Solver, optional) – Solver for biases, default= n2d2.filler.Normal

  • weights_filler (n2d2.filler.Filler, optional) – Weights initial values filler, default= n2d2.filler.Normal

  • bias_filler (n2d2.filler.Filler, optional) – Biases initial values filler, default= n2d2.filler.Normal

  • mapping (n2d2.tensor.Tensor) – Mapping

  • no_bias (bool, optional) – If True, don’t use bias, default=False

  • from_arguments (bool, optional) – If False, allow you to create cell with mandatory arguments set as None, default=False

Return the N2D2 object.

Dropout¶

class n2d2.cell.Dropout(from_arguments=True, **config_parameters)¶

Dropout layer [SHK+12].

Parameters

  • nb_outputs (int) – Number of output channels

  • name (str) – Name for the cell.

  • dropout (float, optional) – The probability with which the value from input would be dropped, default=0.5

  • from_arguments (bool, optional) – If False, allow you to create cell with mandatory arguments set as None, default=False

N2D2()¶

Return the N2D2 object.

ElemWise¶

class n2d2.cell.ElemWise(from_arguments=True, **config_parameters)¶

Element-wise operation layer.

Parameters

  • nb_outputs (int) – Number of output channels

  • name (str) – Name for the cell.

  • operation (str, optional) – Type of operation (Sum, AbsSum, EuclideanSum, Prod, or Max), default=”Sum”

  • weights (float, optional) – Weights for the Sum, AbsSum, and EuclideanSum operation, in the same order as the inputs, default=1.0

  • shifts (float, optional) – Shifts for the Sum and EuclideanSum operation, in the same order as the inputs, default=0.0

  • activation_function (n2d2.activation.ActivationFunction, optional) – Activation function, default= n2d2.activation.Linear

  • from_arguments (bool, optional) – If False, allow you to create cell with mandatory arguments set as None, default=False

N2D2()¶

Return the N2D2 object.

Padding¶

class n2d2.cell.Padding(top_pad, bot_pad, left_pad, right_pad, from_arguments=True, **config_parameters)¶
N2D2()¶

Return the N2D2 object.

Softmax¶

class n2d2.cell.Softmax(from_arguments=True, **config_parameters)¶

Softmax layer.

Parameters

  • nb_outputs (int) – Number of output channels

  • name (str) – Name for the cell.

  • with_loss (bool, optional) – Softmax followed with a multinomial logistic layer, default=False

  • group_size (int, optional) – Softmax is applied on groups of outputs. The group size must be a divisor of nb_outputs parameter, default=0

  • from_arguments (bool, optional) – If False, allow you to create cell with mandatory arguments set as None, default=False

N2D2()¶

Return the N2D2 object.

BatchNorm2d¶

class n2d2.cell.BatchNorm2d(nb_inputs, from_arguments=True, **config_parameters)¶
N2D2()¶

Return the N2D2 object.

LRN¶

class n2d2.cell.LRN(inputs, nb_outputs, from_arguments=True, **config_parameters)¶

Local Response Normalization (LRN) layer. The response-normalized activity \(b_{x,y}^{i}\) is given by the expression:

\[{b_{x,y}^{i}= \frac{a_{x,y}^{i}}{\left(k + \alpha \sum\limits_{j=max(0,i-n/2)}^{min(N-1,i+n/2)}{\left(a_{x,y}^{j}\right)^2}\right)^{\beta}}}\]
Parameters

  • nb_outputs (int) – Number of output channels

  • name (str) – Name for the cell.

  • n (int, optional) – Normalization window width in elements, default=5

  • alpha (float, optional) – Value of the alpha variance scaling parameter in the normalization formula, default=1.0e-4

  • beta (float, optional) – Value of the beta power parameter in the normalization formula, default=0.75

  • k (float, optional) – Value of the k parameter in normalization formula, default=2.0

  • from_arguments (bool, optional) – If False, allow you to create cell with mandatory arguments set as None, default=False

N2D2()¶

Return the N2D2 object.

Pool¶

class n2d2.cell.Pool(pool_dims, from_arguments=True, **config_parameters)¶

Pooling layer.

Parameters

  • pool_dims (list) – Pooling area dimensions

  • pooling (str, optional) – Type of pooling (Max or Average), default=”Max”

  • stride_dims (list, optional) – Dimension of the stride of the kernel.

  • padding_dims (list, optional) – Dimensions of the padding.

  • activation_function (n2d2.activation.ActivationFunction, optional) – Activation function, default= n2d2.activation.Linear

  • from_arguments (bool, optional) – If False, allow you to create cell with mandatory arguments set as None, default=False

N2D2()¶

Return the N2D2 object.

Solver¶

You can associate to some cell a specific weight solver.

..autoclass:: n2d2.solver.Solver
members

inherited-members

SGD¶

class n2d2.solver.SGD(**config_parameters)¶
Parameters

  • datatype (str, optional) – Datatype of the weights, default=float

  • model (str, optional) – Can be either Frame or Frame_CUDA, default=’Frame’

  • learning_rate (float, optional) – Learning rate, default=0.01

  • momentum (float, optional) – Momentum, default=0.0

  • decay (float, optional) – Decay, default=0.0

  • learning_rate_policy (str, optional) – Learning rate decay policy. Can be any of None, StepDecay, ExponentialDecay, InvTDecay, default=’None’

  • learning_rate_step_size (int, optional) – Learning rate step size (in number of stimuli), default=1

  • learning_rate_decay (float, optional) – Learning rate decay, default=0.1

  • clamping (boolean, optional) – If true, clamp the weights and bias between -1 and 1, default=False

N2D2()¶

Return the N2D2 object.

Filler¶

You can associate to some cell a specific weight filler.

..autoclass:: n2d2.filler.Filler
members

inherited-members

He¶

class n2d2.filler.He(**config_parameters)¶

Fill with an normal distribution with normalized variance taking into account the rectifier nonlinearity [HZRS15]. This filler is sometimes referred as MSRA filler.

Parameters

  • datatype (str, optional) – datatype, default=’float’

  • variance_norm (str, optional) – Normalization, can be FanIn, Average or FanOut, default=’FanIn’

  • scaling (float, optional) – Scaling factor, default=1.0

N2D2()¶

Return the N2D2 object.

Normal¶

class n2d2.filler.Normal(**config_parameters)¶

Fill with a normal distribution.

Parameters

  • datatype (str, optional) – datatype, default=’float’

  • mean (float, optional) – Mean value of the distribution, default=0.0

  • std_dev (float, optional) – Standard deviation of the distribution, default=1.0

N2D2()¶

Return the N2D2 object.

Constant¶

class n2d2.filler.Constant(**config_parameters)¶

Fill with a constant value.

Parameters

  • datatype (str, optional) – datatype, default=’float’

  • value (float) – Value for the filling

N2D2()¶

Return the N2D2 object.

Rectifier¶

class n2d2.activation.Rectifier(**config_parameters)¶

Rectifier or ReLU activation function.

Parameters

  • clipping (float, optional) – Clipping value for positive outputs, default=0.0

  • quantizer (n2d2.quantizer.ActivationQuantizer, optional) – Quantizer

N2D2()¶

Return the N2D2 object.

Tanh¶

class n2d2.activation.Tanh(**config_parameters)¶

Tanh activation function.

Computes \(y = tanh(\alpha.x)\).

Parameters

  • alpha (float, optional) – \(\alpha\) parameter, default=1.0

  • quantizer (n2d2.quantizer.ActivationQuantizer, optional) – Quantizer
